original_text: It will cover scope, grammar rules, static analysis including checks for common gate errors and undeclared qubits, a GitHub Actions-based CI integration setup, error taxonomy, and a development roadmap with phases and estimated timelines.
units: It will cover scope , grammar rules , static analysis including checks for common gate errors and undeclared qubits , a GitHub Actions - based CI integration setup , error taxonomy , and a development roadmap with phases and estimated timelines .
including checks for common gate errors and undeclared qubits
GitHub Actions - based

original_text: It will read QASM 2.0 source files (including any included libraries) and perform syntactic and semantic validation without executing the program.
units: It will read QASM 2.0 source files ( including any included libraries ) and perform syntactic and semantic validation without executing the program .
including any included libraries
perform syntactic and semantic validation without executing the program
executing the program

original_text:
## Grammar Rules  
The analyzer must implement the full OpenQASM 2.0 grammar as specified by IBM’s QASM reference ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))
units: The analyzer must implement the full OpenQASM 2.0 grammar as specified by IBM ’s QASM reference ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) )

as specified by IBM ’s QASM reference ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text

original_text: Only one version statement is allowed and it must appear first.
units: Only one version statement is allowed and it must appear first .
it must appear first .

original_text: Comments begin with `//` and run to end-of-line ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working)).
units: Comments begin with ` // ` and run to end - of - line ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) ) .
run to end - of - line ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text
end - of - line

original_text: - **Include Statements:** Lines of the form `include "filename";` must be parsed so that the specified file is opened and its contents processed in place ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working)).
units: - * * Include Statements :* * Lines of the form ` include " filename " ; ` must be parsed so that the specified file is opened and its contents processed in place ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) ) .

original_text: Support declarations `qreg name[size];` and `creg name[size];` for quantum and classical registers ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20only%20storage%20types%20of,to%20a%20bit%20of%20this)).
units: Support declarations ` qreg name[size ] ; ` and ` creg name[size ] ; ` for quantum and classical registers ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20only%20storage%20types%20of , to%20a%20bit%20of%20this ) ) .

` creg name[size ] ; ` for quantum and classical registers ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20only%20storage%20types%20of , to%20a%20bit%20of%20this ) )

original_text: Identifier names start with a lowercase letter and may contain alphanumeric characters or underscores ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20only%20storage%20types%20of,to%20a%20bit%20of%20this)).

original_text: For `qreg name[N]`, the elements `name[j]` for `0 ≤ j < N` denote individual qubits initialized to |0〉; similarly `creg name[N]` defines bits `name[j]` initialized to 0
units: initialized to |0 〉
For ` qreg name[N ] ` , the elements ` name[j ] ` for ` 0 ≤ j < N ` denote individual qubits initialized to |0 〉 ; similarly ` creg name[N ] ` defines bits ` name[j ] ` initialized to 0
` initialized to 0

original_text:
Support user-defined gate (subroutine) syntax as per the QASM 2.0 spec ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name,body)):
  - **Named Gates:** `gate name(params) qargs { body }`.
units: user - defined

Support user - defined gate ( subroutine ) syntax as per the QASM 2.0 spec ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name , body ) ): 
   - * * Named Gates :* * ` gate name(params ) qargs { body } ` .

original_text: - **Opaque Gates:** `opaque name(params) qargs;` declares a gate whose implementation is unspecified (no body) ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=computationally%20challenging%20to%20estimate,declaration%20but%20without%20a%20body)).
units: - * * Opaque Gates :* * ` opaque name(params ) qargs ; ` declares a gate whose implementation is unspecified ( no body ) ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = computationally%20challenging%20to%20estimate , declaration%20but%20without%20a%20body ) ) .
` declares a gate whose implementation is unspecified ( no body )

original_text: The parser should faithfully implement the QASM 2.0 grammar for all of the above constructs, reporting syntax errors (e.g. missing semicolons, mismatched parentheses, invalid tokens) as parsing failures.
units: The parser should faithfully implement the QASM 2.0 grammar for all of the above constructs , reporting syntax errors ( e.g. missing semicolons , mismatched parentheses , invalid tokens ) as parsing failures .
reporting syntax errors ( e.g. missing semicolons , mismatched parentheses , invalid tokens ) as parsing failures

original_text: In particular, it should enforce that the version statement occurs only once at the top and that all statements end with semicolons as required ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))
units: In particular , it should enforce that the version statement occurs only once at the top and that all statements end with semicolons as required ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) )

original_text: For multi-qubit gates (like `CX q1,q2`), check that the same qubit is not used twice (for example, `CX q[0],q[0]` is invalid); the QASM spec explicitly forbids the same qubit in both roles ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=called%20the%20controlled,register%20and%20b%20is%20a)).
units: For multi - qubit gates ( like ` CX q1,q2 ` ) , check that the same qubit is not used twice ( for example , ` CX q[0],q[0 ] ` is invalid )
that the same qubit is not used twice ( for example , ` CX q[0],q[0 ] ` is invalid )

For multi - qubit gates ( like ` CX q1,q2 ` ) , check that the same qubit is not used twice ( for example , ` CX q[0],q[0 ] ` is invalid ) ; the QASM spec explicitly forbids the same qubit in both roles ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = called%20the%20controlled , register%20and%20b%20is%20a ) ) .
= called%20the%20controlled , register%20and%20b%20is%20a ) )

original_text: In general, if a parallel operation is applied to quantum registers, they must have matching sizes.
units: if a parallel operation is applied to quantum registers
In general , if a parallel operation is applied to quantum registers , they must have matching sizes .

original_text: For example, a unitary `U` or custom gate must take quantum arguments (qubit or qreg), not classical bits, and `measure` must map qubits to bits ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built,c)).
units: For example , a unitary ` U ` or custom gate must take quantum arguments ( qubit or qreg ) , not classical bits , and ` measure ` must map qubits to bits ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built , c ) ) .

` measure ` must map qubits to bits ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built , c ) )

original_text: Applying a gate to a classical register, or a measurement target that is not a classical bit, should be flagged.
units: Applying a gate to a classical register , or a measurement target that is not a classical bit
Applying a gate to a classical register , or a measurement target that is not a classical bit , should be flagged .

original_text: For built-in gates, `CX` must have exactly two quantum arguments ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20built,quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa)), and `U` must have three real-parameter arguments.
units: built - in

For built - in gates , ` CX ` must have exactly two quantum arguments ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20built , quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa ) ) , and ` U ` must have three real - parameter arguments .

Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20built , quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa ) ) , and ` U ` must have three real - parameter arguments .

original_text: In gate definitions, ensure bodies follow spec rules ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=Only%20built,The%20quantum%20circuit%20given%20by)).
units: In gate definitions , ensure bodies follow spec rules ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = Only%20built , The%20quantum%20circuit%20given%20by ) ) .
bodies follow spec rules

original_text: For example, parameter names and qubit arguments should be properly scoped, and only allowed statements (gates, barrier) appear.
units: For example , parameter names and qubit arguments should be properly scoped , and only allowed statements ( gates , barrier ) appear .
only allowed statements ( gates , barrier ) appear
statements ( gates , barrier ) appear

original_text: Collectively, these checks will catch common QASM mistakes such as undeclared qubits, duplicate registers, wrong gate arity, type errors, and unreachable or ill-formed code.
units: Collectively , these checks will catch common QASM mistakes such as undeclared qubits , duplicate registers , wrong gate arity , type errors , and unreachable or ill - formed code .
ill - formed

original_text: For example, if a gate name is undefined, the analyzer should produce a compile-time error (“gate X undefined”) ([Support `extern` gate declarations  · Issue #507 · openqasm/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/openqasm/openqasm/issues/507#:~:text=In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before,them%20available%20to%20the%20user)) rather than silently proceeding.
units: For example , if a gate name is undefined , the analyzer should produce a compile - time error ( “ gate X undefined ” )

For example , if a gate name is undefined , the analyzer should produce a compile - time error ( “ gate X undefined ” ) ( [ Support ` extern ` gate declarations   · Issue # 507 · openqasm / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / openqasm / openqasm / issues/507#:~:text = In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before , them%20available%20to%20the%20user ) ) rather than silently proceeding .

original_text: The project will use **GitHub Actions** for continuous integration (CI) to ensure code quality and reliability.
units: The project will use * * GitHub Actions * * for continuous integration ( CI ) to ensure code quality and reliability .
to ensure code quality and reliability

original_text: On each push or pull request, the pipeline checks out the code, sets up a Python environment (e.g. via `actions/setup-python`), installs dependencies, and runs the test suite using `pytest` ([Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-python#:~:text=steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt)).
units: On each push or pull request , the pipeline checks out the code , sets up a Python environment ( e.g. via ` actions / setup - python ` ) , installs dependencies , and runs the test suite using ` pytest ` ( [ Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com / en / actions / use - cases - and - examples / building - and - testing / building - and - testing - python#:~:text = steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt ) ) .

original_text: For example, a step installing and running `ruff` (or `flake8`/`pylint`) ensures adherence to style and catches common Python issues ([Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-python#:~:text=Using%20Ruff%20to%20lint%20and%2For,format%20code)).

original_text: For instance, the pytest step might run commands like `pip install pytest pytest-cov` followed by `pytest --cov=src --cov-report=xml` ([Building and testing Python - GitHub Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-python#:~:text=steps%3A%20,r%20requirements.txt)), and the lint step might run `pip install ruff` then `ruff check .

original_text: Undefined-gate errors are semantic; as one report notes, “the frontend will record an error saying that the gate `cx` is undefined” when it cannot find a gate symbol ([Support `extern` gate declarations  · Issue #507 · openqasm/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/openqasm/openqasm/issues/507#:~:text=In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before,them%20available%20to%20the%20user)).
units: as one report notes
Undefined - gate errors are semantic ; as one report notes , “ the frontend will record an error saying that the gate ` cx ` is undefined ” when it can not find a gate symbol
saying that the gate ` cx ` is undefined ” when it can not find a gate symbol
when it can not find a gate symbol

Undefined - gate errors are semantic ; as one report notes , “ the frontend will record an error saying that the gate ` cx ` is undefined ” when it can not find a gate symbol ( [ Support ` extern ` gate declarations   · Issue # 507 · openqasm / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / openqasm / openqasm / issues/507#:~:text = In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before , them%20available%20to%20the%20user ) ) .

original_text: Examples include gates or registers that are defined but never used (dead code), or operations on a qubit after it has been measured without reset (since the qubit’s state is no longer well-defined) ([Analyzing Quantum Programs with LintQ: A Static Analysis Framework for Qiskit](https://software-lab.org/publications/fse2024_LintQ.pdf#:~:text=analysis%20aimed%20at%20warning%20about,10%20operate%20on%20the%20same)).

original_text:
This structured error taxonomy (syntax vs semantic vs logical) helps users understand the nature of an issue: syntax and semantic errors must be fixed, while logical warnings may highlight inefficiencies or non-critical problems.

## Roadmap
units:
This structured error taxonomy ( syntax vs semantic vs logical ) helps users understand the nature of an issue : syntax and semantic errors must be fixed , while logical warnings may highlight inefficiencies or non - critical problems . 

 # # Roadmap
users understand the nature of an issue :
syntax and semantic errors must be fixed , while logical warnings may highlight inefficiencies or non - critical problems
while logical warnings may highlight inefficiencies or non - critical problems

original_text: Support all grammar rules outlined above, including version, registers, includes, built-in statements, and gate definitions ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))
units: Support all grammar rules outlined above , including version , registers , includes , built - in statements , and gate definitions ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74 / openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com / Mezantrop74 / openqasm / blob / master / spec / qasm2.rst#:~:text = The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human , relative%20to%20the%20current%20working ) )
including version , registers ,
all grammar rules outlined above , including version , registers , includes , built - in statements , and gate definitions ( [ openqasm / spec / qasm2.rst at master ·
